user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_session_cookie:
```c
static void
add_session_cookie (struct Session *session,
                    struct MHD_Response *response)
{
  char cstr[256];
  snprintf (cstr,
            sizeof (cstr),
            "%s=%s",
            COOKIE_NAME,
            session->sid);
  if (MHD_NO ==
      MHD_add_response_header (response,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_SET_COOKIE,
                               cstr))
  {
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to set session cookie header!\n");
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (MHD_NO ==
    MHD_add_response_header (response,
                             MHD_HTTP_HEADER_SET_COOKIE,
                             cstr))
{
  fprintf (stderr,
           "Failed to set session cookie header!\n");
}

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the condition depends on the runtime return value of MHD_add_response_header so both the then-branch (fprintf) and the fall-through are reachable at runtime. A genuine Rule 2.1 violation would require the condition to be a compile-time constant (or the called function to be annotated noreturn), which is not the case in this fragment.
